result.execSummary:
The defendant Paula J Bestland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 2 days sentence credit, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent with: Milwaukee County Case 14CF3220

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $531.20 to be paid as follows:  $331.20 to M.S. and $200 to Westbury Bank.  Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs or fines.  Court will allow the defense to file a Request/Motion for a Restitution Hearing at any point during the Probation Period.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Criminal Thinking Class and follow through if Agent deems appropriate.
No contact with the victim(s) listed in the Criminal Complaint (M.S. and Westbury Bank).

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Paula J Bestland in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
2 Days Credit - If Revoked.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
Court allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Concurrent to:  Milwaukee County Case 14CF3220
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class and follow through if agent deems appropriate.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim listed in the criminal complaint (M.S. and Westbury Bank).
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

RESTITUTION:  $531.20 (Breakdown:  $331.20 - M.S. and $200 - Westbury Bank - restitution to be paid first then costs or fines);
Court will allow the defense to file a Request/Motion for a Restitution Hearing at any point during the Probation Period.
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample (if not already provided) and Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Paula J Bestland in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on March 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
